title: How to Make Cauliflower with Tomato and Cumin Sauce

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/e8\/Cauliflower_cumin_sauce_1_317.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/e\/e8\/Cauliflower_cumin_sauce_1_317.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":317,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":524.4,"licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"}Cook the cauliflower in a saucepan filled with boiling water.
steps.description: Leave the pan uncovered and cook for 10 to 12 minutes. Wait until the cauliflower is tender. Strain the water out into the sink.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/9c\/Cauliflower_cumin_sauce_2_141.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/9\/9c\/Cauliflower_cumin_sauce_2_141.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":322,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":532,"licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"}Melt the butter in a separate pan and fry the garlic, cumin, and onion pieces for about 3 minutes.
steps.description: Mix in the tomatoes and let the mixture simmer for another 5 to 8 minutes.

steps.headline:
{"smallUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/2d\/Cauliflower_cumin_sauce_3_452.PNG","bigUrl":"https:\/\/www.wikihow.com\/images\/2\/2d\/Cauliflower_cumin_sauce_3_452.PNG","smallWidth":460,"smallHeight":322,"bigWidth":760,"bigHeight":532,"licensing":"

\n<\/p><\/div>"}Place the cauliflower into the pan and mix thoroughly.
